thread.title: Adam Le Fondre thrives alongside Benik Afobe
thread.title_full: Adam Le Fondre thrives alongside Benik Afobe

title: Adam Le Fondre thrives alongside Benik Afobe
text:
Tweet 
Le Fondre began life at Wolves on the bench and struggled for fitness since arriving on loan from Championship rivals Cardiff City. 
But, since Nouha Dicko’s season-ending injury, he has become an integral member of the squad and scored his second goal in three games during Sunday’s 4-2 defeat at Derby. 
Afobe is also finding the net regularly and Le Fondre said of the partnership: “I think it’s going well, you can see we’re working together, we’ve linked up really well . 
“In the first-half (at Derby) we were threatening, we looked to get in between the lines down the side of them, we were creating opportunities. 
“It’s going really well between me and Ben. It’s nice to get some consistency now and kick on and start scoring goals more regularly. It’s three in five starts for me now. 
“I want to keep this going and push us up the league.” 
Afobe has three in his last two matches and seven in 13 this season. 
Boss Kenny Jackett, who is still chasing a striker on loan to back the pair up, with only teenager Bright Enobakhare on the bench at the moment, agreed the partnership was developing nicely. 
Jackett said: "They’re both capable of scoring goals and getting the ball to them with quality in the right areas is something we’re looking to do. More on this story:
